column5: My Top 20 Films (no particular ranking), since 4 movies are not nearly enough.
One of the only movies that accurately manages to capture Proust’s ambiance.
Andrei Rublev has that quality found in some of the most relevant literary pieces. It watches as an absolute epic. Andrei Rublev is a deep metaphysical meditation on the nature of faith.
The provocative work of the century, made possible by the master provocateur. I've never been so attracted to an actress the way I became attracted to Deneuve in this film.
This movie will always feel contemporary to me. It literally transcends time.

column2: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
column5: The most beautiful depiction of romance I've ever seen.
The most painful depiction of cowardice I've ever seen.
The most breathtaking closing scene I've ever seen. Also, the only movie that has made me desperately cry.
The most enigmatic & hypnotic movie I've ever seen.
The strongest twist I've ever experienced in cinema. Also, one of the most heartbreaking endings I've ever seen.
The atmosphere, the way the bodies move, the performances, the soundtrack, the cinematography, everything is perfect in Suspiria 2018.
The most insane closing scene (tied with Incendies) I’ve experienced
The most eloquent and pungent critic to high society I’ve seen
The most erotic film I’ve ever seen.
The most insanely accurate depiction of jealousy and desire I’ve seen.
